### Importacion de Librerias.

```{r librerias}
suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(dplyr))
library(datasauRus)
```

### Visualizacion de Datos
```{r visualizacion}
datasaurus_dozen %>%
  group_by(dataset) %>%
  summarise(
    mean_x    = mean(x),
    mean_y    = mean(y),
    std_dev_x = sd(x),
    std_dev_y = sd(y),
    corr_x_y  = cor(x, y)
  )
```

```{r libreriaG}
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r visualizacionG}
ggplot(datasaurus_dozen, aes(x = x, y = y, color = dataset)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_void() +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  facet_wrap(~dataset, ncol = 3)
```


### TAREA

Visualizacion de la regresion Lineal en figura **STAR**

```{r regresion_star, echo=TRUE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(datasauRus)

# Filtrar el dataset "star"
star_data <- datasaurus_dozen %>% 
  filter(dataset == "star")

# Gráfico con estilo oscuro y moderno
ggplot(star_data, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_point(
    color = "#F4D03F",   # amarillo brillante
    size = 2.8,
    alpha = 0.85
  ) +
  geom_smooth(
    method = "lm",
    color = "#58D68D",   # verde esmeralda
    se = TRUE,
    fill = "#58D68D33",  # verde translúcido
    linewidth = 1
  ) +
  labs(
    title = "Regresión Lineal: 'Star'",
    subtitle = "Visualización con estilo oscuro y línea de tendencia (verde)",
    x = "Variable X",
    y = "Variable Y",
    caption = "Fuente: Datasaurus Dozen"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14, base_family = "Arial") +
  theme(
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#1C1C1C", color = NA), # fondo oscuro
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = "#1C1C1C", color = NA),
    panel.grid.major = element_line(color = "#333333", linetype = "dotted"),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", color = "#F7F9F9", size = 18),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(color = "#BFC9CA", size = 13),
    axis.title = element_text(color = "#EAECEE", face = "bold"),
    axis.text = element_text(color = "#D5DBDB"),
    plot.caption = element_text(color = "#AEB6BF", hjust = 1)
  )

```
